DOC.brief_summary: Objectives : 1 ) To evaluate effect early compression therapy individualize exercise incidence low limb lymphedema 12 month post-operatively patient treat gynecological cancer risk develop lymphedema ; 2 ) To evaluate effect early compression therapy individualize exercise lower limb volume , quality life incidence cellulitis infection 12 month post-operatively population .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Early Compression Exercise Lymphedema Incidence Patients With Gynecological Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Study design setting : A pilot randomize control trial conduct 50 patient gynecological cancer recruit McGill University Health Centre ( MUHC ) Royal Victoria Hospital Jewish General Hospital ( JGH ) Segal Cancer Centre Montreal , Quebec . The data collection intervention conduct MUHC Lymphedema Support Centre . Intervention : At 4-6 week post-operatively , participant experimental group prescribe Jobst Elvarex compression class 1 ( 18 21 mmHg ) standard custom-made stocking low limb without panty . The participant recommend wear garment 12 16 hour daily least 6 month post-operatively . At time , participant also receive individualized education exercise , self-lymphatic drainage skin care unblinded lymphedema therapist . Control : At 4-6 week post-operatively ( T2 ) , group receive standard education lymphedema risk reduction along printed material Lymphedema Association Quebec .
DOC.criteria: 18 year age ; diagnosis grade 2 3 endometrial cancer , high grade type ( serous clear cell ) , stage 1b1 stage 2a cervical cancer , stage 1 vulvar cancer tumor great 4 cm , stage 2 3 vulvar cancer ; undergo surgical lymph node dissection . recurrent diagnosis gynecological cancer ; presence distant metastasis ( stage 4 cancer ) ; body mass index 35 great .
